commands.name: /addemojis
commands.description: Adds all team logos to the server as emojis.

commands.name: /advanceseason
commands.description: Advances the season by 1 and sets teams' season records to 0.

commands.name: /bold <text> <bold-type>
commands.description: Allows you to generate custom bolded text.

commands.name: /botstats
commands.description: Shows some fun statistics about the bot, including the number of unique users, leagues, and uptime.

commands.name: /challenge <challenging-team> <offending-team> <rule-violated> <ruling>
commands.description: Posts a ruling by a referee regarding a challenge that a team makes against another team.

commands.name: /channel <channel-mention> <purpose>
commands.description: Links the channel you mentioned for a specific purpose, like for transactions or demands.

commands.name: /contractoffer <player> <terms>
commands.description: Allows a franchise owner or general manager to send a contract offer to a player, who can choose to accept or decline.

commands.name: /defensestats <user> <tackles> <ints> <touchdowns> <sacks> <safeties> <fumble-recoveries>
commands.description: Logs a player's defensive stats, as shown on the FF2 'Defense' server stats.

commands.name: /demand
commands.description: Allows you to demand from your team as long as you are under the demand limit for the league.

commands.name: /demote <user>
commands.description: Allows you to demote a player from their role. To demote franchise owners, you must be an admin. Otherwise, you must be a franchise owner.

commands.name: /disband <team>
commands.description: Disbands a team by removing all of the team's players. Only usable by admins.

commands.name: /disbandall <minimum-players>
commands.description: Disbands all teams that have less than a certain number of players. Only usable by admins.

commands.name: /fo <user> <team>
commands.description: Allows admins to promote an individual to be the franchise owner of a team, if the position is vacant.

commands.name: /gametime <team1> <team2> <time>
commands.description: Posts the gametime between one team and another team. Gametimes may be posted by franchise owners or general managers.

commands.name: /help
commands.description: Displays helpful information about Anarchy commands.

commands.name: /kstats <user> <attempts> <good-attempts>
commands.description: Logs a players kicker stats, as shown on the FF2 'Kicker' server stats.

commands.name: /lfp <message>
commands.description: Posts a 'looking for players' message if the proper channel is set.

commands.name: /logo <team> <link>
commands.description: Changes the logo of a team to the specified link. Valid links must direct to an image.

commands.name: /maxplayers <number>
commands.description: Sets the player cap for all teams in the league to the specified number. May only be ran by admins.

commands.name: /newteam <full-name> <abbreviation> <logo>
commands.description: Creates a new team and its associated role. May only be ran by admins. The logo must be a valid link directing to an image.

commands.name: /offer <player>
commands.description: Allows a franchise owner or general manager to send a signing offer to a player, who can choose to accept or decline.

commands.name: /presence <type> <value>
commands.description: Allows the bot owner (Donovan#3771) to change the bot's status.

commands.name: /pickup <link>
commands.description: Posts a pickup game. Only usable by managers or admins.

commands.name: /poststats <your-team> <your-score> <other-team> <other-score> <qb-stats> <rb-stats> <wr-stats> <defense-stats> <kicker-stats>
commands.description: Posts stats from a game. Usable by franchise owners, general managers and head coaches.

commands.name: /promote <player> <role>
commands.description: Allows a franchise owner to promote a specific player to either head coach or general manager.

commands.name: /qbb <player1> <player2> <link>
commands.description: Posts a QBB. Only usable by managers or admins.

commands.name: /qbstats <user> <completions> <attempts> <touchdowns> <ints> <yards>
commands.description: Logs a players quarterback stats, as shown on the FF2 'Passing' server stats.

commands.name: /rbstats <user> <attempts> <touchdowns> <yards>
commands.description: Logs a players runningback stats, as shown on the FF2 'Rushing' server stats.

commands.name: /refreshcommands
commands.description: Refreshes all bot commands without having to do a complete shutdown of Anarchy. Only usable by Donovan.

commands.name: /release <user>
commands.description: Releases a user from their team.

commands.name: /removeteam <team>
commands.description: Removes the team from the bot's database and deletes the team role.

commands.name: /results <team1> <team2> <team1-score> <team2-score>
commands.description: Logs the game's score and posts it into the proper channel. May be run by admins or managers.

commands.name: /revertresults <game-id>
commands.description: Reverts the results of a game in the event that it was improperly logged. May be run by admins or managers.

commands.name: /ring <team>
commands.description: Gives all members of the specified team a ring, and keeps track of how many rings the team itself has run. May only be run by admins.

commands.name: /roster <team>
commands.description: Allows you to view the roster of a team.

commands.name: /schedule <deadline>
commands.description: Allows you to automatically generate a random schedule with a specified deadline.

commands.name: /setdemands <number>
commands.description: Sets the max demands each person is allowed to have. Only admins may run this command.

commands.name: /setup
commands.description: Runs you through the setup prompt for Anarchy. May only be run by admins.

commands.name: /sign <user>
commands.description: Allows you to sign a player to your team. This is commonly referred to as 'force signing', and can only be done by franchise owners and general managers.

commands.name: /standings
commands.description: Allows you to view team standings for that season. **This command should be used in conjunction with /results, as /results keeps track of scores for one game.**

commands.name: /statsheet <position> <season>
commands.description: Allows you to view a statsheet for an (optional) previous season, for a specific position.

commands.name: /suspend <player> <reason> <duration>
commands.description: Allows a manager or admin to suspend a player.

commands.name: /suspensions
commands.description: Allows you to view current active suspensions.

commands.name: /teams
commands.description: Allows you to view all teams and their franchise owners. Similar to 'focheck' for other bots.

commands.name: /toggle <command> <state>
commands.description: Allows you to toggle a command on and off. Currently, you may only toggle offers and signings. May only be run by admins.

commands.name: /trade <player1> <player2>
commands.description: Allows trade one player for another player. May only be run by franchise owners and general managers.

commands.name: /unsuspend <user>
commands.description: Allows admins or managers to unsuspend a player.

commands.name: /whitelist <user> <role>
commands.description: Allows you to unwhitelist a user as a manager or an admin, for use in other commands. May only be run by a server owner.

commands.name: /whitelist <user> <role>
commands.description: Allows you to whitelist a user as a manager or an admin, for use in other commands. May only be run by a server owner.

commands.name: /wrstats <attempts> <touchdowns> <yards>
commands.description: Logs your wide receiver stats, as shown on the FF2 'Receiving' server stats.
